name: SiebelReview: Force Active property Set to TRUE at BusComp level
description:
In general, customers should avoid the use of the Force Active property for BusComp fields and BusComps themselves.
Use of this property at the field level specifies that any time the BusComp is instantiated, the field in question should be active and part of the SELECT statement.
In the case where the BusComp level Force Active property is set, every field in the BusComp is included in the SELECT statement.
When overused, both behaviors degrade performance.
Note that this behavior applies whether the BusComp is referenced on an applet, in script, through workflow, EAI, or any other object manager function.
output: This rule reports Business Components having a Force Active property set to TRUE
rationale: Many fields have the property Force Active unnecessarily set to TRUE.
remediation:
The purpose of the Force Active property is to ensure a field is always available in script.
In general, rather than use Force Active, customers should activate fields with the ActivateField method in conjunction with an ExecuteQuery method.  This will activate the field only when truly needed, and not with every instantiation of the BusComp.
The only case where Force Active is necessary is that in which script must interact with a UI instance of a BusComp that does not already provide access to a field due to its presence on an applet, and it is not practical to requery the BusComp with script.
Verify that all of the fields with this property set to TRUE are necessary and if not, set the property to FALSE to limit the number of fields queried.  Where the property must be set to TRUE, document on the field the specific scripts which require it; as scripts change over time, it may be possible to reduce the number of Force Active fields.
Where the standard application has used this property, do not change it.  This typically means that the application requires the objects activation for a business service (script executed outside of the BusComp) or for specialized class reasons.  Removing this property could cause the business service or class to fail.
In future releases of the application, this property may not be available, as Engineering has considered removing it from Siebel Tools due to the significant performance degradation that occurs when overused.
